Sentencas: In this paper, a novel system integrating chemical-looping hydrogen generation (CLH) system and solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) has been proposed.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of a Novel Chemical Looping Hydrogen Generation System Integrated with SOFC

Sentencas: This new methane-fuelled energy system was investigated with energy balance and exergy analysis.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of a Novel Chemical Looping Hydrogen Generation System Integrated with SOFC

Sentencas: CLH produces the hydrogen as the fuel of the SOFC, and the FeO and Fe3O4 are selected as the looping material.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of a Novel Chemical Looping Hydrogen Generation System Integrated with SOFC

Sentencas: Waste heat from the SOFC is absorbed by the CLH and converted to chemical energy through the reduction reaction of CLH.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of a Novel Chemical Looping Hydrogen Generation System Integrated with SOFC

Sentencas: Owing to the cascade utilization of the fuel between the CLH and SOFC, the net efficiency of this novel system can achieve 62.8% considering CO2 separation, more than 10 percentage points higher than a methane reforming fuelled SOFC system.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of a Novel Chemical Looping Hydrogen Generation System Integrated with SOFC

Sentencas: Meanwhile, by using the CLH to produce the hydrogen, the CO2 can be recovered without an energy penalty.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of a Novel Chemical Looping Hydrogen Generation System Integrated with SOFC

Sentencas: Through the analysis of the graphical exergy, the cascade utilization of waste heat and the high-efficiency hydrogen production is the main reason of high performance.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of a Novel Chemical Looping Hydrogen Generation System Integrated with SOFC

Sentencas: This novel system also has the advantage of CO2 capture without energy penalty, so this combined system is an advantaged method to accomplish the efficient utilization of methane.
Titulo: Exergy Analysis of a Novel Chemical Looping Hydrogen Generation System Integrated with SOFC
